titles.title: Anti-Surrogate-Mother Act of 1987
A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit certain conduct relating to surrogate motherhood.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 9/15/1987--Introduced. Anti-Surrogate-Mother Act of 1987 - Amends the Federal criminal code to provide criminal penalties for anyone who: (1) procures or attempts to procure any woman to engage in surrogate motherhood; (2) provides medical assistance in carrying out an agreement to engage in surrogate motherhood; (3) advertises any services in connection with surrogate motherhood; or (4) sells the right to adopt a child or brokers such a sale. Makes any individual or institution convicted of violating this Act ineligible to receive Federal financial assistance for any medical program or activity that such individual or institution engages in as a provider. Makes any contract for surrogate motherhood null and void.
